topics.body:
I couldn't help but notice that the world record for the longest time playing video games was taken by some guy playing only Call of Duty. I was talking to my boyfriend about it; seems like kind of a shame, doesn't it? With all of these great games out there, and COD is what takes home the grand prize. 

I'd challenge it, except a) I have a life, and b) I have a feeling this would come up for the rest of my life when seeking out employment.
topics.author: 5041b54f7f123b77af00a442

topics.body:
"@Number1pegasus":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53c409716368725e86d50000#post_53c409716368725e86d50000
[bq="Number1pegasus"]"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53c4037d63687270ad520000#post_53c4037d63687270ad520000
Oh jeez, Thank god science is around. Animal blood doesn't really seem safe. [/bq]
The thing a lot of people don't know is that a lot of mythology is based off of something.
Werewolves are based off of hypertrichosis(werewolf syndrome; disease where a person grows hair all over their body), sea dragon myths are based off of oarfish, atlantis was actually a greece trading town that was on top of a caldera, giant squid actually do exist, hobbits were another species of now extinct humans, berserkers were warriors that would take bufotenine to go apeshit in battle, captain ahab is based off of Captain Pollard, Okapi were once mythical, hell even tigers used to be mythical.

Here's something else cool:
Yeti's may be real; what I mean by this is that right now there's a expedition being planned cause of hair found matching a pre-historic type of polar bear.  Sorry bigfoot fans, but if it turns out to be true it's just a polar bear that was thought to be extinct.
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600

topics.body:
"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53c40cf86368725e55460100#post_53c40cf86368725e55460100
Jackalopes were derived from a growth disorder from rabbits.
Unicorns were based on pretty much any horse-like hoofed animals with horns. Biblical accounts were likely Arabian Oryxes.
The Behemoth was likely a Hippopotamus.
Leviathan, a whale.

Gyrados was based on a Chinese legend where it was believe if a carp leaps over the Dragon Gate, hey become dragons.
The Loch Ness, and similar creatures such as the Ogopogo of Okanagan Lake were probably floating logs.

目を覚ませ　The time to go
強くあるために
また　護ることと戦うこと
Dilemma　は終わらない…走りつづけても

In the growing universe Can you feel? 
Now let’s talk about a small star

Tell me the truth the future I believed in
Is about to crumble away

Repeating sorrow

Now in the hearts of everyone
Wake up The time to go
To go forth strong
To protect and to fight again
The Dilemma doesn't end… even if we keep running
